dt.t: The words {it}lead{/it}, as in the metal, and {it}lead{/it}, as in the verb, are {wi}homonyms{/wi}.

dt: {bc}one of two or more words spelled and pronounced alike but different in meaning (such as the noun {it}quail{/it} and the verb {it}quail{/it})
{bc}a taxonomic designation rejected as invalid because the identical term has been used to designate another group of the same rank {dx}compare {dxt|synonym||}{/dx}

et: Latin {it}homonymum{/it}, from Greek {it}homōnymon{/it}, from neuter of {it}homōnymos{/it}
shortdef: one of two or more words spelled and pronounced alike but different in meaning (such as the noun quail and the verb quail)
